0.user_question: A fruit vendor bought 50 watermelons for $6199980. He sold all of them at a profit of 25%. How much was each watermelon sold?

ost_step.1: First calculate the selling price (SP) using cost price (CP). For making 25% profit on CP ($6199980), SP can be calculated as follows; Sp(total)=Cp+(profit/100)*Cp=Cp*(1+Profit Percentage/100)=$6199980*[(1+25)/100]=7799975 . Step 2: To find out individual unit Sale Price then divide it over number of units or items Sold i.e., Total Units :SellingPricePerUnit=(TotalSpilledValue /NumberOfUnits ) In this case , Number Of Watermelons Bought Is Equal To Unit Or Item Count Named As n ; Formula becomes like This =>n=[$7799975/$50] Which Yields Value OF INDIVIDUAL WATMELLON AS:$155999.5 Hence Answer Will Be=> Each Watermelon Was Rs.$155999.5
ost_step.2: Thus We Have Individual sale price per item OR watermelon amounting TO::Rs.:155999.5 Therefore Our Answers Are Completed And Correctly Provided..!!!

0.user_question: A fruit vendor bought 50 watermelons for $6199980. He sold all of them at a profit of 25%. How much was each watermelon sold?

1.subquestion: Firstly, what will be the selling price if the vendor makes a profit of 25% over their cost price (which includes purchase costs)?

subanswer.text: To make a profit of 25%, the selling price should be Cost Price plus an additional quarter (i.e., Profit) equal to Total Sale Price. Thus, let x represent the sale price per unit; therefore, 50x = $6199980 + 0.25(50x). Solving yields x = ($6199980)/(75), or approximately $82666.4. The answer is about $82666.4.

direct_answer.text:
To calculate this properly using basic math principles rather than relying solely on hints would involve understanding markups as percentages of cost prices. Let me explain it clearly first before providing detailed steps.  
Step 1: Calculate initial individual cost including profit margin which equals market value/quantity i.e.$61,99,980/50= $1,23,999.6 This means initially one watermelon cost him around $1,23,999.6 . Step 2: As we know gaining 25% profits implies sell amount being greater than buy amount thus adding another $1/sq ft onto its original area hence making new surface area equivalent to old surface+original_surface*(gain %). Hence you multiply the earlier calculated square feet worth($1,23,999.6 )with gain percentage expressed through decimal point form('1+' gains ''). You get overall sum spent upon buying these units. Additional expenses include space expansion due to increased areas needed during sales since every single quantity increases proportionately when multiplied together yielding bigger product totals. Subtract previous outlay$6199980

0.user_question: A fruit vendor bought 50 watermelons for $6199980. He sold all of them at a profit of 25%. How much was each watermelon sold?

1.subquestion: Firstly, what will be the selling price if the vendor makes a profit of 25% over their cost price (which includes purchase costs)?

subanswer.text: To make a profit of 25%, the selling price should be Cost Price plus an additional quarter (i.e., Profit) equal to Total Sale Price. Thus, let x represent the sale price per unit; therefore, 50x = $6199980 + 0.25(50x). Solving yields x = ($6199980)/(75), or approximately $82666.4. The answer is about $82666.4.

ost_step.1: Therefore, each watermelon was sold for about $82666.4/50 which equals roughly $1653.32.

Cost Per Watermelon= Total Cost / Quantity  
                             = $6199980 / 50   
                             = $123999.6

0.user_question: A fruit vendor bought 50 watermelons for $6199980. He sold all of them at a profit of 25%. How much was each watermelon sold?

direct_answer.text: Firstly let’s find out what is cost price per watermelon. Total amount spent / no of watermelons= Cost Price/watermelon.$6199980/$50=$123999.6$ Each melon costs Rs $123999.6$.Now we know Watermelons need to sell it (profit)%*costprice/100$$\begin{aligned} \text { Profit percentage } & :25\% \\ selling\_prc&=\frac{\text {Profit %}}{100}\times \text {CostPrice}\\ &=\frac{25}{100}\times  123999.6\\ &=Rs \, 30999.9\end{aligned}$So if you add this extra cash ($30999.9$) into your initial investment($123999.6$),you get sale_prc=$(initial+extra)=(123999.6)+(30999.9)$ This equals $$=(154999.5)$.
